top_comment.text: sorry for asking,, is it Hyorin or HyoLyn?? #thanksforinfo  ﻿
top_comment.author: Monica Hanny Puspita

comments.text: okay.. thank you so much...
comments.author: Monica Hanny Puspita

comments.text:
Hmm not quite sure, I don't really know Japanese but I think they have the 
l/r thing too.
comments.author: hatrickyman

comments.text: is it the same as Japanese?
comments.author: Monica Hanny Puspita

comments.text:
The reason it is different is because of the character ㄹ in her name, this 
character is romanized as l/r because it pretty much sounds like you are 
trying to say both letters at the same time, kinda like a small roll of the 
tongue.
comments.author: hatrickyman

comments.text: ohhh thank you.. ;))
comments.author: Monica Hanny Puspita

comments.text:
Hyolyn is romanzied hangul and Hyorin is how it is pronounced, whilst 
writing Hyolyn would be correct but while speaking it is said Hyorin, 
either way it doesn't really matter.
comments.author: hatrickyman

title: [MV] Dynamic Duo(다이나믹듀오) _ Hot Wings (날개뼈) (Feat. HyoLyn(효린) of Sistar(씨스타))
